sentences.sContent: Entitled William Eggleston's Guide, it was the first show of colour photography at Moma, a decision that incensed the critics almost as much as the supposedly banal and vulgar subject matter.
sentences.sContent_eng: Entitled William Eggleston's Guide, it was the first show of colour photography at Moma, a decision that incensed the critics almost as much as the supposedly banal and vulgar subject matter.
sentences.sCn: 这次名为“威廉·埃格斯顿指南”的展览，是纽约现代艺术博物馆的第一场彩色摄影展。 展示彩色作品，激怒批评家的程度，几乎不下于这些作品所谓平庸和粗俗的题材。

sentences.sContent: This proposal will incense conservation campaigners.
sentences.sCn: 这项提议将激怒自然保护的倡导者。

trans.tranOther: If you say that something incenses you, you mean that it makes you extremely angry
